channel.title: Gay commands

item.title: Gay commands
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

[quote=“WestSideMass, post:4, topic:310295”]I’ll explain this a little better, the command;

if(command.startsWith("hail") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("luke")) { hail(); }
Is saying that only the user “luke” can type that command and get a result.

The code;

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("hail") && playerRights > 1) { hail(); }
Is saying that any users ranked 1 (Moderator) or higher can use that command.

If you are ever trying to convert a single user command to a single rank command, always go from this;

if(command.startsWith("command") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("name")) {

to this;

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("command") && playerRights > #)

If this is still confusing, feel free to ask questions.[/quote]

dude, im not entirly stupid including both the above posts answer my question.

anyway, i guess thanks? :s

i just wasnt too sure what playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("name")) {

did.

Read full topic

item.title: Gay commands
item.dc:creator: @WestSideMass WestSideMass
item.description:
@WestSideMass wrote:

I’ll explain this a little better, the command;

if(command.startsWith("hail") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("luke")) { hail(); }
Is saying that only the user “luke” can type that command and get a result.

The code;

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("hail") && playerRights > 1) { hail(); }
Is saying that any users ranked 1 (Moderator) or higher can use that command.

If you are ever trying to convert a single user command to a single rank command, always go from this;

if(command.startsWith("command") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("name")) {

to this;

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("command") && playerRights > #)

If this is still confusing, feel free to ask questions.

Read full topic

item.description:

anyway, i really dont understand these commands:

if(command.startsWith("hail") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("luke")) { hail(); }

tbh, that means everyone can do right?, i tryed adding the playerrights bit but idk how to add it, i tryed but i get errors, this is what i tryed:

if(command.startsWith("hail") && playerRights > 2 && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("luke")) { hail(); }

anyone know how to actually do it?
